message.content:
cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.NI 

This paper deals with the design and implementation of erasure codes for distributed storage systems. The paper discusses the optimization of storage, reliability, I/O operations, and repair bandwidth, which are all related to distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also involves information theory (cs.IT) as it discusses the minimum-storage regenerating (MSR) codes and their limitations. The paper also deals with system-level issues (cs.SY) such as the practical implementation of the codes in Hadoop. Additionally, the paper involves distributed systems (cs.DS) and networking (cs.NI) as it discusses the data-read and data-transfer aspects of the codes.
